frameDefinitions: A Tester uses a concrete or conceptual Product in order to determine either whether it works or to find out how well or in which manner it works.
Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer adding some Phenomenon to their model of the world.

This is an abstract frame for durative activities, in which the Agent enters an ongoing state of the Activity, remains in this state for some Duration of Time, and leaves this state either by finishing or by stopping.
This frame deals with testing or examination of someone's Knowledge or skill in a particular area.
This frame concerns a Cognizer (a person or other intelligent being) paying close attention to something, the Ground, in order to discover and note its salient characteristics.
An Experimenter conducts an Experiment based on a Hypothesis.
frameExamples: Sun has (hopefully) already <t>tested</t> it for compliance.
Later that night, they <t>found</t> the barely-alive victim inside the Red Hall estate flat.
At the end of the trial period all three groups took an English for Commerce <t><fex name='Examination'>examination</fex></t> to assess progress.
We <t>searched</t> the yard  for my contact lens.
Johann's <t><fex name='Experiment'>experiment</fex></t> proved the new drug was effective in treating the disease.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who uses  the <fen>Product</fen> to see if it is intact or to ascertain its characteristics during operation.
The entity that the <fen>Tester</fen> uses  to ascertain whether it is intact.
An entity or property whose presence would impair the acceptability or usefulness of the <fen>Product</fen>.
An action that the <fen>Tester</fen> intends to accomplish subjecting the <fen>Product</fen> to a test of its functioning.
The desirable state of affairs which the <fen>Tester</fen> hopes to find to obtain when using the <fen>Product</fen>.
A variable of behavior of the <fen>Product</fen> which is specifically evaluated.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Tester</fen> uses  the <fen>Product</fen> to evaluate its functioning.
The location in which the test is carried out.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who becomes aware of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. It is normally expressed as an External Argument.
Thm <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the entity or situation in the world of which a <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware. It is normally expressed as an Object:
This role identifes the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Topic</fen> indicates the general field within which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is found.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> uses an <fen>Instrument</fen> to (enable themselves to) become aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.  In some cases, the <fen>Instrument</fen> may appear in subject position.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> in which the  <fen>Agent</fen>  is engaged.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is engaged in the <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
One who administers a test of some kind.
One who undergoes a test of some kind.
The ability, practice, or command of information on which an <fen>Examinee</fen> is tested.
A credential or status that one acquires by passing an <fen>Examination</fen>.
The <fen>Examination</fen> that somebody takes.
The time at which the examination occurs.
The location where the examination takes place.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The role is normally expressed as an External Argument:

The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to the <fen>Ground</fen>, so named because it serves as the background or context for the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. This role can be expressed as an NP Object or as a PP Complement.

The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The role is normally expressed as an External Argument:
An entity directed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>  that interacts with the <fen>Ground</fen> to accomplish the scrutiny.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is scrutinizing the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The <fen>Experimenter</fen> is the individual conducting the <fen>Experiment</fen>.
The group of entities in the <fen>Experiment</fen> which have not been treated and are compared to the <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or <fen>Treated_individual</fen>.
An individual entity of the <fen>Experiment</fen> which is left untreated and then compared with the <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or the <fen>Treated_individual</fen>.
A group of subjects that receive Treatment and are compared to the <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fex name='Controlled_individual'>Controlled_individuals</fex>.
An individual subject that receives treatment and is then compared to the <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fen>Controlled_individual</fen>.
The test or <fen>Experiment</fen> conducted by the <fen>Experimenter</fen> using a <fen>Control_group</fen> and a <fen>Treatment_group</fen>.
The <fen>Hypothesis</fen> is a conjecture as to the result of an <fen>Experiment</fen>.  The <fen>Experiment</fen> takes place in order to prove the <fen>Hypothesis</fen> as correct or incorrect.

In this frame <fen>Control_group</fen> and <fen>Treatment_group</fen> can be combined and expressed as <fen>Subjects</fen>.  This role can also be used for a generic individual on whom the <fen>Experiment</fen> is being conducted (see second example).
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject that the <fen>Experiment</fen> is studying.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Experimenter</fen> conducts the <fen>Experiment</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Experiment</fen> is conducted.
listRoleExamples: I just wish <fex>we</fex> could have tested the car with a manual gearbox, instead of the five-speed automatic
To ensure that the remedy is complete, nCipher have fully reviewed the software and tested it <fex>for similar errors</fex>.
Once you have copied your site and have tested it <fex>to make sure it works normally</fex>, you're ready to pull out the scalpel and start hacking away.
Test-Driven Development requires you to set an expectation of a result and then test <fex>that the result is achieved</fex>.
ILCSO staff have tested <fex>the behavior of the ILCSO-standard version of WebVoyage with several browsers</fex>.
We tested the product <fex>in California</fex> first.
<fex>Pat</fex> discovered a great little restaurant in Soho.
Pat discovered <fex>a great little restaurant</fex> in Soho.
<fex>By opening the book to page 10</fex>, you will find the Van Eerdens' number.
Scientists attempt to make discoveries <fex>about the laws of nature</fex>.
Olson says the deputy came out to the farm and detected a radioactive substance <fex>with his Geiger counter</fex>.
Robbie had wondered if they would be able to find the path <fex>at night</fex>.
<fex>The teacher</fex> tested the students.
<fex>The students</fex> took a test.
I took my <fex>driving</fex> test.
He took the <fex>college entrance</fex> <t>exam</t>.
<fex>The examination</fex> tests driving skills.
<fex>Leslie</fex> examined the glass for cracks.
Leslie examined <fex>the glass</fex> for cracks.
<fex>Chapter four</fex> examined the case for free speech.
The temperature controller monitored the temperature <fex>with a calibrated silicon diode</fex>.
<fex>Justin's</fex> experiment turned out to be rather successful.
<fex>One rat's</fex> treatment caused it to outlive the rats of the control group.
Katrina tested <fex>her hypothesis</fex> yesterday afternoon.
They were hoping to conduct an experiment <fex>on the albino rats</fex>.
Jimmy conducted an experiment <fex>on tropical plants in non-tropical environments</fex>.

passageCandidateSpans.text: the Max Planck Institute of Physical Chemistry
